column4: can someone tell me where the tightvnc config file is please?
is it running?
That's the thing I don't know
sorry that was a typo
.... sooo check in your processes :)
you can try installing 'qps', is in the repos, which is a visual processes manager
Done. and 'ps -ea' doean't show that it's running
the configuration file is either in a folder in ~ or an 'rc' file there too.... if you can run it, do so, and then run a lsof -C APPNAME; to shows what files it has open/inuse
can't find qps in the menu anywhere
you need to install it :)     sudo apt-get install qps
I just used synaptic to install it
Nope it's not running. Anyidea how to start it?
...    no.... ahemm   you mean you installed it and you dunno how to launch it?
NEw to linux and I tried going via the /etc/init.d/tightvncserver start route
what about the man pages?    checked ->   man tight<TAB>
so you installed it and dunno how to run it?
Yes.. I'm new to this whole linux suite of programs
go to the console and use autocomplete :)  ->   php<tab>
it will show the available commands starting with THAT
nothing listed
have you looked in your apps menus yet?
well it's installed according to synaptic
then it'd show in the menus usually, with the rest of the apps under some category, for php I'd think under web development or such
